Title: Minister Kasaija tables 41.2 tn budget
Content:
The Minister of finance Matia Kasaija has tabled a budget of 41.2 trillion shillings for the next financial year 2021/2022.

According to the proposed budget tabled before the parliament’s budget committee by the minister of finance Matia Kasaija on Tuesday, Governance, and Security will take the lion's  share with 7.7 trillion shillings.

This will be followed by human capital development, which covers education and high level training, at 6.8 trillion shillings. 

Integrated transport infrastructure and services will take 3.9 trillion, Agro industrialization will take 1.4 trillion, and regional development 1.2 trillion shillings.
   According to the Minister, in this budget which is 4.3 trillion shillings less than last year's budget, they have decided to bring together all the current funds for development like the youth livelihood fund, the Operation Wealth Creation, the women entrepreneurship program among others and created a parish model which they will use to assist Ugandans develop.

Title: Sand mining blamed for Poor Rukungiri Roads
Content:
Sand mining activities   along roads   accompanied by heavy rains have been blamed for the poor state of  roads in Rukungiri district. 

As a result,community leaders have been asked to lead the drive to protect roads and bridges in their communities against selfish elements who normally extract sand from or alongside roads,  compromising their strength and durability which in turn leads to their collapse.  

This is according to the Rukungiri District Civil Engineer, Mr Bagira Julius,who disclosed this during an interview with Boona FM.

Mr. Bagira said it is the responsibility of every Ugandan citizen to safeguard community structures at their disposal.

 According to Bagira,these structures take a lot of taxpayers' money to establish and maintain therefore they should be protected.

 He warned that once these structures are damaged, they may take long  and cost  lot of money to repair or reconstruct.

He said once most community roads are rehabilitated, some selfish people tend to extract the gravel alongside the road, an act which he condemned

Title: Substandard solar products flood the market.
Content:
70% of the solar energy products marketed in Uganda are sub standard!

A survey carried out in 2020 by the Uganda bureu of standards indicates that 1 out of every 3 solar products on the market do not conform to standards  recognized by the International Electro technical Commission (IEC) and Lighting Global Standards.

it is against this background that the Uganda National Bureau of Standards (UNBS) has rolled out regional awareness campaigns targeting solar energy consumers and dealers ahead of their proposed crackdown on substandard products in the next financial year.
The standards body is planning intense civic discourse country wide  with   entrepreneurs; solar energy consumers and dealers ahead of this crackdown

After the nationwide sensitization, the UNBS’ Market surveillance team will start enforcing the standards across the country to seize and destroy non-compliant solar products. Solar energy consumers have been complaining of inferior solar products on that market that do not reflect value for money.    


Benon Bena, the Manager Local Energy under the Rural Electrification Agency - REA a statutory body of the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Development, said the awareness campaign is intended to ensure consumers get quality products that match value for money.


Andrew Othieno, the Standards Development Manager at UNBS  says that the regional public awareness campaign is aimed at accelerating access to electricity or solar energy in line with the Vision 2040 that targets to ensure that 80% of the population have access to power.

Title: Government worried about increasing Non-communicable diseases.
Content:
35% of all Ugandans who die in Hospitals succumb to Non-Communicable diseases

Dr Joyce Moriku Kaduchu, the state minister of Health in charge of primary health care say the burden of Non Communicable diseases continues to increase as a result of increase to ignorance about NCDs and unhealthy lifestyles

She was Thursday  morning addressing the Press in Kampala

She noted that 80% of 335 covid-19 deaths were related to either diabetes or hypertension.

Dr Kaduchu has appealed to Ugandans to embrace healthy diets rich in vegetables, to avoid refined sugars, take less salt, avoid excessive alcohol consumption and engage in physical activity for at least 30 minutes a day.

Title: Keep bees to protect your gardens, Rukungiri CAO to QENP neighbors.
Content:
Communities  neighboring  Queen Elizabeth National Park in Bwambara sub county Rukungiri district have been encouraged to start  bee keeping projects  along side   their gardens as a temporary measure  to dissuade  stray wild life from destroying their crops as they wait for the government to erect an electric fence.

  Rukungiri district Chief Administrative Officer Elias Byamungu suggested this intervention while responding to the question raised by   Ian Niwagaba one of the resident who was concerned about the    continued destruction of crop  gardens by elephants and other animals from the park.

Byamungu  on Wednesday conducted  one day visit to supervise   government projects in the area.

According to Nuwagaba ,they previously used to receive compensation from the government through the sub county but this has since stopped

Byamungu assured the residents that the government is aware of the problems caused by animals from the park and that they are devising  solutions  as well as working on the compensation of the victims.

QENP is in the Western Region of Uganda, spanning the districts of Kasese, Kamwenge, Rubirizi, and Rukungiri. The park includes the Maramagambo Forest and borders the Kigezi Game Reserve, the Kyambura Game Reserve, and the Kibale National Park in Uganda, and the Virunga National Park in the Democratic Republic of the Congo.  Queen Elizabeth National Park is known for its wildlife, including African buffalo, Ugandan kob, hippopotamus, giant forest hog, warthog, Nile crocodile, African bush elephant, African leopard, lion, and chimpanzee. It is home to 95 mammal species and over 500 bird species. The area

Title: Eng Turyahikayo re-appointed as REA Boss
Content:
Eng Godfrey Turyahikayo, the long serving head of the Rural Elctrification Agency has been given another  term  at the helm of  the  body following a re-appointment By president Yoweri Museveni.

In a letter dated  11th April  to minister of energy and mineral development  Hon. Mary Gorret Kitutu,  President Museveni  has  appointed  Engineer Turyahikayo  as the executive director for eighteen months and Eng William Charles Lutwama as his new  deputy for a period of 3 years with effect from 1st may , 2021.

 Mr Godfrey Turyahikayo,  led  the Agency from inception   in 2003,  but his one-year contract extension expired  in 2020 and has been awaiting renewal.

 President Museveni has in his letter  now directed the line minister  to organize the current management to start preparing to hand over to the new appointees.

Eng Godfrey Turyahikayo is  husband  to  Rubabo county member of parliament Hon. Mary Paula Turyahikayo.

His tenure at the Rural Electrification Agency oversaw the connection of power to several areas in western Uganda  including  parts of Rukungiri , Kanungu , Kabale , Kisoro  isingiro among others.

Title: Rukungiri district leaders meet locals over Bwambara PWD land
Content:
By Obadiah Twinomuhwezi.

Rukungiri district leaders have directed the occupants of the  64 acre  land  that belongs to people with disabilities   to desist from selling it without the consent of the government.

The resolution was made during a meeting between the community and district leaders who include Lc5 Andrewson Katebire,CAO Byamungu Elias, deputy RDC Birungi Abubaker over the  land located in kikomo cell,Bwambara parish, bwambara sub county rukungiri district .

The land was which initially was gazetted  for people with disabilities in western region in the  1960s’.

By that time ,less than twenty PWDS settled on the same piece of land before  it was  partitioned into categories.

Some o f the PWDs who initially settled on this land were Anania Lubega, Ruterameizi,Loy Abaho,Veronica Tumushabe,Kaabwita Anania,Yokaana among others.

The categories of the PWDs meant to benefit from the said land are the blind, these affected by leprosy while others with general impairments  were also to benefit however due to intermarriages and the death of the original PWDS, some of the members of the community started claiming the ownership of the land.

The children of the deceased who have been using this land  were forced  to sell their plots  after they were threatened with eveiction by an unnamed bigshot  who claimed   ownership.

Adrewson Charles Katebire the rukungiri district Lc5 boss advised the  current occupants who are the offspring of the original settlers that it would be better  if those above 18years can vacate and look for their own land since they are not disabled.

Meanwhile Abubaker Birungi the deputy RDC tasked the sub county to take control of the land as they wait for the handover of the land title to the district from the land commission. The current occupants were  allowed  to continue using the land but barred from  selling it.

The Rukungiri district CAO Elias Byamungu cautioned the public against encroaching government land and that this same land has been proposed as a construction site for the industrial park.

Title: Rukungiri man kills grandfather over 15000.
Content:
Police in Rukungiri is hunting for A 30-year-old man  who  is on the run after stabbing his 74-year-old grandfather to death.

 Elly Maate the Kigezi Regional Police Spokesman identified the deceased as Bernard Barugahare, a resident of Kanyankyende village in Bugangari sub county.

 The deceased, , was on Saturday  night   attacked by his grandson one Kamwesigye Jackson alias Boy

 Maate says Kamwesigye grabbed his grandfather outside house and stabbed him in the neck to death in the presence of the latter’s wife one Tugumisirize Edisa, 73.

The suspect was reportedly incensed at the non-payment of his wages amounting to 15000 for the work he did for his grandfather as a casual worker.

Edisa tried to make an alarm which attracted the neighbors that they arrived too late

Maate says police visited the scene and recovered the murder weapon, a knife, and the body was taken Rwakabengo healthy center 111 mortuary for post-mortem.

 The manhunt for the suspect is ongoing.

Title: Rukungiri Livestock Farmers Urged To Be On The Look-Out For FMD
Content:
JAVILLA MUGABE

Livestock farmers in Rukungiri district have been advised to look out  for the signs and symptoms of the Foot and Mouth Disease within their herds and flocks.

Rukungiri District Veterinary Officer Dr Ninsiima Johnson,  says farmers should be on the look out for animals that develop wounds around their hooves and mouths, and those that develop string saliva as these are the  signs of an animal infected by the disease.

This comes at a time when  districts close to Rukungiri District like Kiruhura, Mbarara and Sheema are hit by the Foot and Mouth Disease outbreak.

  Affected animals have an unsteady gait  because of the painful hooves while mouth wounds make them unable to feed.

The Foot and Mouth Disease commonly known only  as FMD affects all animals with hooves including the swine and even those that live in the  wilderness.

Rukungiri district has not registered any case of the disease as of today but measures to control it including restricted movement of animals  have been stepped up.

Title: Rukungiri Lodge owners move to tighten security.
Content:
Lodge Owners in Rukungiri Municipality are moving to tighten the registration of clients following  last Thursday's  attack at  Amazon Lodge that lead to the death of Amon Niwagaba.

The deceased, Nuwagaba Amon, went to Amazon lodge  in Rukungiri town on Thursday Last week, but unknown assailants  got access into his room unnoticed  and clobbered him to death.

The assailants completed their gruesome mission unnoticed and vanished into the night leaving the murder weapon at the scene of the crime.

 Now Rukungiri entrepreneurs association chairman Chrysostom Byaruhanga also known as Rwakana has asked all lodge owners and employees  to resume the registration of  their clients before hosting them.

Byaruhanga says the registration of lodge occupants which had been instituted by government to fight insecurity  had been relaxed leading to incidences of crime

He  said that every lodge owner and operator  needs to have  security personnel to monitor activities taking place around the Lodge  so that they can be in position  detect and deter crime at the lodging premises.

Title: Digital Connectivity and payments boost SME performance in Uganda
Content:
Joshua Tukesiga

The performance of Small Medium Enterprises (SMEs) in Uganda is increasingly being driven by  Internet connectivity and digital payments.

 This was revealed at an online thought-leadership forum hosted by Airtel Uganda under the theme, E- commerce and digital connectivity opportunities for SMEs,on Friday, 16th April 2021.

Commenting on the role of digital connectivity opportunities for SMEs, Allan Semakula, DirectorEnterprise at Airtel Uganda mentioned that, due to lockdown and health standard operating procedures issued by the Government , the new normal has opened up the digital space and e-commerce to SMEs , thus facilitating more e-commerce transactions.”

He added that, payments like Airtel Money which are safer from a health are being preferred to cheques and physical cash.

Ssemakula predicted that time where  the balance in terms of scale between cash and digital payments might shift to 90% digital payments.”

According to the 2020 fourth quarter Uganda Communications Commission Market Performance Report, mobile money transactions crossed the 1 billion transactions mark for the first time surpassing the previous quarterly record of 954 million transactions.

This translates into an average of 15 transactions per active mobile money account every month.  

According to Uganda Investment Authority, SMEs account for approximately 90% of the entire private sector, generating over 80% of manufactured output that contributes 20% of Uganda’s gross domestic product (GDP).

Tony Otoa, Chief Executive at Stanbic Business Incubator said that,  there is a lot of evolvement in the SME space  that makes it more important to  embrace the digital platform.”

Speaking at the forum, John Kakungulu Walugembe, Executive Director, at the Federation of Small and Medium Enterprises-Uganda revealed   collaboration with the policy makers and the different stakeholders in the SME chain is key as this will enable the government to attain its agenda of digital transformation.

Title: NKD's Bishop Magezi warns on Domestic Violence
Content:
North Kigezi diocese Bishop Rt Rev Benon Magezi has cited dishonesty and poverty as the main causes of domestic violence in Rukungiri district.

The Rukungiri district probation and welfare office has registered more than 50 cases of domestic violence especially against women during Covid Lockdown yet others go unregistered.

Bishop Magezi in an exclusive interview with Boona FM on Tuesday said that many people face domestic violence   because they don’t have enough money to meet all their family necessities.

He further noted that adultery has created instability in many families.  

 Bishop Magezi warns that domestic violence is dangerous and continues    break up families hence and take lives.

He implored married couples to engage in dialogue whenever they have a misunderstanding, and involve God in their marriages

Title: Minister Rukutana shooting case set for 30th April
Content:
Ntungamo

The chief magistrates Court in Ntungamo led by his worship Gordon Muhimbise has fixed Friday 30th April 2021 as the day on which it will deliver its detailed judgment on the case in which thelabour state minister Hon Mwesigwa Rukutana is accused of shooting at one of his former opponent’s agents during last year’s NRM party elections in Rushenyi county.

The incident is said to have happened in  Rubaare Rushenyi county Ntungamo district.Sub County on 5th September 2020  

The  prosecution has presented 12 witnesses to pin minister Rukutanin a trial  that lasted for 9 days

One defense witness appeared in court today.

Minister Rukutana was arraigned in the court to face charges of attempted murder, assault, malicious damage, and threatening violence.

He denied all allegations noting that they are politically motivated to taint his image.

 The chief magistrate Court has since invited all the parties to appear in court on 30th April 2021 at 9: 00AM for the judgment.

Title: Bushenyi Pastor arrested over defilement
Content:
A born again Pastor is being held by Bushenyi Police for allegedly defiling and making a 14-year-old girl pregnant.

Greater Bushenyi Police Spokesperson Martial Tumusiime has identified the suspect as Apostle Solomon Kushemererwa, 36, a resident of Tank Hill Bushenyi town.

Kushemererwa is a Pastor at Starlight International worship Centre, Nyakabirizi in Bushenyi Ishaka municipality.

Tumusiime says Kushemererwa was arrested after a complaint by the father of the victim who reported a case at Bushenyi Central Police station.

Martial says the girl whose names have been concealed because she is a minor was checked and the police medical report showed that the girl was one month pregnant. 

Tumusiime says the act of defilement is suspected to have happened in March and the girl kept quiet.

The victim’s father and a resident of Nyabikyerere cell in central division of Bushenyi Ishaka municipality, says his wife saw changes in their daughter who was vomiting and when she took her to the health centre to treat her for malaria, she was instead found pregnant.
Martial says the case is under investigations as the girl is receiving counselling from the police family and child protection unit.

Title: Kanungu Sand mines re-opened
Content:
Sand mining activities in Kanungu that had been halted following the loss of lives due collapsing sand pits has been restored with new stringent regulations to guide the site owners, truck drivers, sand miners  and loaders.

Kanungu Resident District commissioner Hajj Shafiq Sekandi yesterday met stakeholders both at Kiruruma kihihi and Katete Mines respectively to pave a way forward  

The meeting agreed on several regulations including a total ban on Night time mining, the deployment of security at the sand mined and recording of vehicles on entry, and the banning of children below 18 from mining.

  Site owners were also ordered to restore all degraded sites by filling up all open holes and plant stabilizer trees   

 The district leadership   will provide an excavator to level the heaps of sand before re-opening of the mines.

Mr. Julius Tugumenawe, the DPC Kanungu said sand is a mineral that needs to be valued such that the owners can also benefit from it as a source of income.   

Agaba Goerge, the acting District Natural resource officer for Kanungu cited the mining regulations and Act, where he informed the public that government own all land below six feet from ground level and exploiting it is translated as   encroaching on government land.

  Two committees were formed to work with the district team in enforcing the regulations.

Title: Discharged child-patients to be followed up using smart phone technology
Content:
Obadiah

Ministry of Health in partnership with WALIMU an NGO on Thursday launched a new health program dubbed SMART DISCHARGE PROJECT to serve the sub counties of Nyakishenyi and Nyarushanje in Rukungiri district.

The objective of this initiative is to reduce the fatalities of children under the age of 6 after being discharged from health facilities.

Some 5-10% of African children with a serious infection die in the hospital, and an even higher percentage of children die in the weeks after their discharge. Doctors and parents are often unaware of this period of high vulnerability. The mobile phone application developed by this project for hospital use will help to identify at-risk children.

 Under this programme, Village Health Teams will take the charge of the discharged children from their respective areas to assess their health conditions till they are totally recovered to avoid post discharge deaths.

The launching function took place at Kisiizi Hospital tourism centre in kisiizi parish Nyarushanje sub county.

Dr.Ronald Cheke from the ministry of health encouraged the development partners to involve the communities in this programme through sensitization and pledged maximum support from the ministry of health.

 Mucunguzi Akasima the DHO Rukungiri district applauded the partners for the initiative and urged parents/ guardians to cooperate with VHTs     A mobile phone application developed by this project for hospital use will help to identify at-risk children who need referral to a community health worker, while parents will receive a discharge kit to help guide care for their recovering child.

Title: Rukungiri Municipal PWDs receive project grants.
Content:
Obadiah Twino.

People living with disabilities from the divisions of Rukungiri municipality on Friday received their long waited financial support through National Special Grant for People with disabilities aimed at improving the livelihoods of PWDs.

The grant was launched at rukungiri municipal offices where seven groups will each pocket seven million.

The groups include Rwentondo and kitimba goat rearing projects, Rwentondo poultry project, Association of PWD goat rearing project, Ndorero Balema goats project, Karangaro PWD goats project and Kitimba pig rearing project.

Charles Makuru the Rukungiri municipality mayor speaking at the launch appealed to  the first phase beneficiaries to share with some of the PWDs who have not yet joined the groups and urged them to invest in productive projects and not misusing the funds.

Makuru lamented that as a government representative, will keep monitoring all these projects to fulfil the grant objective.

Emmy Turyomugyenyi the municipal councillor representing PWDs commended the government for support and urged members to cooperate.

Ambrose Tusiime the principle Community Developnment Officer Rukungiri municipality called upon beneficiaries to set up signposts for their projects, cooperate and tag their animals for easy identification.

Title: Rukungiri Murder suspect apprehended
Content:
Police in Rukungiri is holding 55-year old Deograsias Babweyoreka, a resident of Rushinya cell in Burama Parish, Bwambara sub county in Rukungiri district, over the brutal murder of 36-year old Veneranda Nyinamisango of the same area.

  The suspect was on Thursday night reportedly  smoked out of hiding by residents  who handed him over to the Police for further action.

Babweyoreka has been on the run since Thursday after allegedly killing Nyinamisango  accusing her of stealing his nine million shillings.

According to area residents, the two have had a lengthy misunderstanding arising from money Nuwamisingo got from the sale of a disputed piece of land.

It’s alleged that the deceased has been in Police cells on allegation of stealing nine million shillings from Babweyoreka who went and reported to Bikurungu police station and the deceased was arrested with her husband and another suspect.

She was thereafter discharged on Wednesday and went back to Babweyoreka’s home to pick her properties and that’s where she met her death.  
Kigezi region Police publicist Elly maate Maate condemned the act and calls upon the public to cooperate with Police so that such issues are handled before claiming lives.

Police recovered exhibits from the scene and the body was taken to Rwakabengo Health Centre III mortuary pending post-mortem.

Even before Babweyoreka was arrested, the case of murder by stabbing had been registered at Rukungiri Central Police station under Reference number 749/2021

Title: Police Probes Kisoro Suicide
Content:
Police in Kisoro district are investigating circumstances under which a 32 year old man  committed suicide.

Elly Maate the Kigezi Region Police spokesperson  identified the deceased as Emmanuel Ziragora a resident of Karambi village Gasovu parish Nyarusiza sub county in Kisoro district.

Maate said that the deceased had domestic problems and has  telling people that he will commit suicide.

Maate said that the matter was reported at Chahi police for intervention but when Police summoned him, he instead ran away.

Maate also narrated that It was today morning that he was found dead, dangling on a rope in his bedroom in the absence of the wife. 

Maate adds that he was discovered by the young children he was staying with who informed others in the homestead .

Title: Minister Magezi blocks Kitagata Hot spring redevelopment
Content:
Local government Minister Raphael Magezi has ordered Kitagata town council and Sheema district to to back off plans to redevelop Kitagata Hot springs after a public outcry against the same.

The Minister’s issued the directive following several engagements with stakeholders.

Hon Magezi along with Justice and constitutional affairs   Minister Ephraim Kamuntu on Friday held several meetings with different stakeholders over the planned redevelopement which faced opposition from residents.

 The meetings involved hot spring users, community, the local leaders and Sheema district leadership.

Hon Magezi   ordered the Kitagata town council and the Ministry of Tourism and Antiquities to call off all their planned activities because the President offered it to the community.

Minister Magezi noted that he reached this decision after perusing through a letter presented to him by the Kitagata hotspring users with over 640 signatures.

 The Minister also advised the family of Ibaara John who claim the ownership of the land on which the hotsprings are situated to value it so that the government can compensate them,  

Mr. Kakonge Apollo Lee the Executive Director of Western Ankole Civil Society Forum among the people who started the campaign against the redevelopment advised the town council leadership and the District to value the community that benefits from the magical waters of this hotspring other than chasing them like chicken thieves.

Title: Kanungu gets 2 health centers at shs 3.2bn
Content:
Two  new health centres in Kanungu District are to be constructed a cost of shs 3.2 billion to boost health service delivery in the district.

The Kanungu Resident District Commissioner (RDC) Shafique Ssekandi Sengooba says, is Kirima Health centre III in Kirima Sub County will be constructed while Bugongi Health Center II in Bugongi Sub County will be elevated to a health center III .

Hajji Shafque Ssekandi said that the construction of the Health Centers is in line with the Government’s Health Policy of having a Health Centre III in every Sub County.

  The civil works will be undertaken by Arch Designs Ltd and Excel Construction Company Ltd.

Ssekandi observed that locals from the 2 benefiting sub counties will be able to access quality health services from the two facilities that will also offer services to people from the neighboring    Democratic Republic of Congo.

He called upon the contractors to ensure quality work    

 Hajji Shafque Ssekandi thanked Mwebesa Benon who donated the piece of land on which Bugongi Health Center III is to be constructed.

The Ministry of Health representative Kiberu Denis says the   source of funding for the two projects has already been identified   adding that the Ministry expects the contractor to hand over finished work after 16 months.

Title: 150 dismissed from UPF over corruption
Content:
153 Police officers have been shown the exit engaging in corrupt and indiscipline tendencies  .

The Deputy Inspector General of Police, Maj Gen Paul Lokech revealed in March that more than 100 police officers were to be expelled from police force for continuously involving themselves in corruption as well as indiscipline activities.

Police council, appointments committee and police authority have with effect from today dismissed and discharged 153 police officers in the lower and senior category.
Fred Enanga, the force spokesperson, has confirmed police’s decision to dismiss and discharge 153 police personnel. Of these, Enanga said 23 were disgracefully dismissed over repeated corrupt trends ranging from 2016 to 2019.

Title: Kyotera man cuts own throat after wife leaves him
Content:
A jilted man in Kyotera district has committed suicide by cutting his throat.

Edward Mulindwa, a resident of Ninzi village in Kalisiro town council reportedly ended his life this morning.

His lifeless body was found lying in a pool of blood inside his house. Mulindwa is suspected to have ended his life because of a dispute with his wife, Winfred Mukisa resulting from excessive drunkenness.   

Mukisa says that she left her marital home about two weeks ago and opted to stay with her parents because of Mulindwa’s attacks and threats to kill her.  

 Residents say Mulindwa had a mental problem, which they believe originated from excessive alcohol consumption and marijuana smoking.  
Lawrence Kabugo, the Ninzi LC I chairperson, says that Mulindwa has been a menace to the community for some time.

Title: Ntungamo health centre upgrades to cost Shs 3.4bn
Content:
The government has secured UGX3.4 billion from the World Bank towards refurbishing Buhanama and Rwoho centre IIs in Ntungamo District and upgrading them to health centre IIIs under Uganda Reproductive Maternal Child Health Improvement Project (URMCHIP).

During the site handover to the Excel construction Limited over the weekend, the Deputy RDC Ntungamo Byarugaba Isaiah Kanyamahaane warned the constructors against arrogance and shoddy work which may lead to the termination of their contract.

Kanyamahaane noted that most of the contractors especially those who are from the ministry level   are arrogant and under look community members and leaders yet they are their supervisors on the ground.

However, Kanyamahaane cautioned all health workers against negligence while on duty that it is unacceptable for Ugandans to continue dying in health units due to negligence on the side of health workers.

Title: Guards held for Shooting Kigezi High school student.
Content:
Police in Kabale are holding 3 security guards attached to SWAT security company who allegedly shot and injured a student of Kigezi high school.

The three are; Moses Murengezi 23 yrs, Mathew Akatuhurira 28 yrs and Sulaiman Baryanazigu 24 yrs.

Elly Maate the Kigezi Police mouthpiece identified the injured student is Bright Akatukunda 19 yrs of senior five who was shot in both legs and now admitted at Kabale referral hospital.

The incident happened on the 22/04/2021 at around 9P.M when senior six  students    clashed with  security guards that were forcing them out of their dormitories for night classes  

In the process, the students badly assaulted Sirivano Bakawerayo one of the security guards who was found off duty at  his place of residence in the school quarters   

The rampaging students  also also damaged that school house that accommodates the guards

Maate says the assaulted guard is admitted at Kabale referral hospital.

Police  immediately deployed to secure the school as the guards were arrested to help in investigations.

Inquiries are underway.

Title: Murder in Rukungiri, 18 year old in Police custody
Content:
Police in Rukungiri is holding an 18 year old resident of Kabeshekyere cell Rwengiri parish Rukungiri district over the murder of Asiimwe Weren 40yrs a resident of Karerema cell, Nyabitete parish Bugangari.

Elly mate the Kigezi police PRO says that the incident happened on the  14/04/2021   at Rugando trading center in Karerema cell.

The deceased who was with his wife and one other relative Joan Ainembabazi , were trailed by Paskal Aheereza, the suspect, who had set his eyes on Ainembabazi  intending to force her into sexual relations.

A fight ensued as the deceased defended his relative.

Mate says the following day the deceased developed severe stomach-ache and was taken to Nyakibare hospital for treatment.

When the pain persisted, the matter was reported to Bugangari police station on the 20/4/2021, and inquiries were initiated.

Asiimwe passed on yesterday afternoon, Police was notified, scene was visited, and Postmortem was done.

The suspect was already in Rukungiri police custody, and inquiries are ongoing.

Title: Kisiizi hospital finance manager remanded over embezzlement
Content:
The Finance Manager for  Kisiizi Hospital in Nyarushanje sub-county, Rukungiri District has been charged and remanded to Kitalya Maximum Prison over embezzlement of hospital funds.

Ronnie Ameri Okello, 35, a resident of Andrews village in Mbarara was arrested last week for allegedly embezzling more than One billion and twenty-three million Shillings, which was meant for the procurement of medicines between January 2019 and May 2020.

 Moses Mugume, the senior hospital administrator says that Okello would use forged documents and receipts to account for the money, while the hospital struggled with a shortage of drugs.
 
 On Wednesday afternoon, Moses Nabende, the Grade One Magistrate of the Anti-Corruption Court remanded Okello to Kitalya Maximum Prison in Wakiso district until May 12.  

Nabende did not allow Okello to say anything saying that the case being criminal in nature is beyond his jurisdiction and can only be handled by the High Court.
  Kisiizi Hospital is a community hospital affiliated with the Anglican Church of Uganda. It was founded by missionary John Sharp in 1958 and was later taken over by the North Kigezi Diocese in Rukungiri District.

Title: Farmers warned on Veterinary Drug misuse
Content:
Javilla Mugabe

Ignoring prescriptions on veterinary drugs will continue to negatively affect livestock health and their products, unless livestock farmers take necessary action.

 The warning was sounded by the Rukungiri District Veterinary officer Mr. Ninsiima Johnson who also called upon livestock farmers to be mindful of precautions indicated on livestock drugs they use on their animals.

 While talking to our reporter who met him in his office today, Mr. Ninsiima said that usage of drugs in contradiction   to the manufacturer's precautions is hazardous not only to the health of livestock but also to humans as it affects animal products.

Mr. Ninsiima, also said that the disregard of manufacturer's precautions has been reported even in districts outside Rukungiri  resulting into  drug resistant ticks, mites, and even diseases. 

He also warned farmers who mix up drugs Saying that they make cocktails of drugs meant for crop pests or diseases with veterinary drugs, which according to him, is equally hazardous to the health of both livestock and humans.

He called upon farmers always to seek advice from veterinarians, especially when they are changing from a drug brand to another.

Title: Rukungiri Marks world day for health and safety at work.
Content:
EMMA MURUNGI STINO

As Uganda joined the rest of the world to celebrate and commemorate world day for safety and health at work, Rukungiri district senior labour officer Charlene Twesime has challenged employers to medically examine their employee’s status of health every after three months, enroll them for insurance and provide them with personal protective gears if they want to create a conducive working environment.

In 2003, the International labour organization under the United Nations began to observe 28th April as world day for safety and health at work for the prevention of accidents and diseases at work,  

Twesime said that quarterly medical examination of workers helps employers and employees plan better.

Twesime also implored employers and employees to always document terms and conditions of work to avoid payment related issues noting that her office receives many cases related to payment.

Title: Accessibility hampering service delivery at Bwama health Centre in Kabale district.
Content:
OBED

Concerns over the Inaccessibility of Bwama health center III at Bwama Island between Lake Bunyonyi in Ndorwa West, Kitumba Sub County Kabale district are being raised by health officials and the general population at large.

The Bwama health centre 111  in charge   Dr. Ronald Ngabirano  who spoke to journalists during a  media tour organized  by the Ministry of Health, UNICEF   said that patients fail to cross the lake which leads to loss of lives and some women deliver in their way before reaching the health centre.

He further appealed to the government to create a mechanism that could bring patients quickly to the facility.

Oliver Namanya the Assistant District Health Officer – Environmental Health explained that one of the challenges they have experienced during this COVID-19 vaccination exercise is the accessibility of facilities like Bwama .

She added that the boats need to be fuelled to transport health facility staff, and to also collect members of the community from the lake shores to the health centre, and back to the shores.

He noted that the district relies on primary health care grants from the government which are inadequate to support several health services in the district.

Namanya appealed to the Ministry of Health and its partners to increase the facilitation for health workers , provide fuel for district health vehicles, and more fuel for Bwama Health Centre to use in the boats, noting that the facility serves many  people from most  districts of Kigezi region.

 The Ministry of Health Senior Public Relations Officer Emmanuel Ainebyoona said that the officer in charge of Bwama health centre should point out the challenge of   fuel in the budget   for government to consider.

Bwama health centre 111 receives 20 patients on daily basis and 50 patients on market days which are Monday and Friday.

The health centre can only be accessed using boats

Title: Teacher arrested for sexually abusing 16 pupils
Content:
A former teacher at Step by Step School in Nansana municipality, Wakiso district  is being held by Police in Kampala  for sexually abusing 16 girls.

Moses Mpanga Aldo, a resident of Nansana municipality in Wakiso district is said to have committed the offence between 2019 and 2020.

Luke Owoyesigire, the Deputy Kampala Metropolitan Police Spokesperson, says that police have recorded statements from the parents of the victims and commenced inquiries into the matter.

Title: Rukungiri receives heifers, boars and gilts from OWC
Content:
Rukungiri district has today received 20 heifers and 272 gilts and boars from operation wealth creation to be distributed to selected beneficiaries.

While receiving heifers, gilts and boars at Rukungiri district headquarters Rukungiri district resident commissioner Stephen Nsubuga Bewayo advised beneficiaries to carefully look after heifers, gilts and boars such that they can help them uplift their standards of living.

Rukungiri district operation wealth creation coordinator Col.Martin Nahurira implored beneficiaries not to sell off the heifers, gilts and boars they have been given,   

He further warned that whoever sells them will be arrested.  

 Rukungiri chief administrative officer Elias Byamungu thanked   government for always remembering it’s people on ground. He challenged those that have not yet benefited from operation wealth creation to visit their sub county production department offices, in order to be guided on how to benefit.

Rukungiri district productions officer Zephar Karyeija said that the production department made pre-inspection to ensure that the supplier does not supply poor quality inputs and that  all animals supplied are of good quality.

Title: Kinkiizi Diocese Pioneer Bishop passes on.
Content:
The Pioneer Bishop of the Diocese of Kinkiizi  Bp Emeritus John Wilson  Ntegereize  has gone to be with the Lord

According to the Diocesan Secretary Rev Can Kenneth Kanyankore, Bishop Ntegyereize who served between 1995 to 2010 died at Bwindi Community Hospital in Kanungu district.

Bishop Ntegyereize will be remembered for pioneering the  Diocese of Kinkizi in 1995   with several projects in health education , water and sanitation, Batwa development environment and capital projects.

He retired in 2010 and was succeeded by the current Bishop, Dan Zoreka

Title: Congestion At Mbarara Regional Refferal hospital; Expectant mothers at risk.
Content:
Expectant  mothers and their babies accessing health care services at Mbarara regional referral hospital are at the  risk of contracting avoidable diseases due to  congestion and sleeping in temporary structures.

Currently tents are being used as wards for postoperative and antenatal care.

The information was released by senior health workers at Mbarara regional referral hospital as the media visited the hospital to check on the status of health service delivery as midwives and nurses laid down their tools over the delay by government to clear their lunch allowances amounting to over shs 70bn.

By the time the media left the hospital at 4 pm on Wednesday May 5, 2021 no nurse or midwife was seen in any ward at the hospital.

At the maternity ward it was student interns that were providing health care to the incoming expectant mothers including administration of medicines.

The executive director Mbarara regional referral hospital Dr Celestine Barigye could not be reached for comment by his known telephone contact.

Title: 14 perish in Masaka Road accident
Content:
14 people have been confirmed dead in Masaka City after a commuter taxi collided with a trailer Thursday morning.

Police said a Tanzanian trailer registration number TH77 BVW / T433 BDY collided with a Toyota HiAce registration number UBE 995C that was travelling from Sembabule-Matete to Kampala. 
The accident happened at Kasijagirwa village when the trailer driver tried to overtake on the wrong side of the road,

Greater Masaka regional police public relations officer, ASP Muhammad Nsubuga said the 14 people died on spot.

Title: S2 students to report next week
Content:
Senior Two students are to return to school next Wednesday, according to a new arrangement announced by the  Ministry of Education and Sports  

They had been scheduled to return to school on May 31, 2021.
Ismail Mulindwa, the director of Basic Education, said the revision of the reporting date came after Senior Four and Senior Six students returned home after completing examinations.

This means parents are now expected to look for school fees in less than a week. However, many parents lost jobs and businesses due to the lockdown.
School administrators have been asking parents to bring learners after paying school fees, saying the institutions don’t have enough resources to feed the students and pay teachers. Mr Mulindwa said the date when the term for Senior Two students will end will be communicated  .

Title: Rukungiri gears up for livestock census
Content:
As the country prepares for the 2021 livestock census, it has been revealed that the right figures of animals per region are essential for appropriate planning and resource allocation.

This is according to the Rukungiri District Veterinary officer Mr. Ninsiima Johnson in an exclusive interview with Boona FM on Thursday.

Ninsiima,urged livestock farmers to cooperate with enumerators by provide the right information regarding their livestock, adding that the right figures will help Government to make better and adequate plans for the farmers and their animals, especially towards the procurement of drugs.

The animal census will be conducted countrywide, starting from 17th to 28th this month. Enumerators will be moving from house to house to assess the number of animals reared per homestead.

Uganda last held animal census in 2008 when it had 11.408,740 cattle,12,449,656 goats,3,413,340 sheep and 3,184,300 swine while Rukungiri district alone had 60,060 cattle,134,757 goats,19,330 sheep and 25,180 pigs.

Title: Murder in Rukungiri, 73 year old brutally killed in Buyanja Subcounty.
Content:
Police in Rukungiri district are investigating circumstances under which a 73-year-old man was killed by yet to be known assailants.

The deceased who has been identified as Yonasan Batabaire a resident of Nyakina parish in Buyanja sub county of Rukungiri district was on the 8th of May 2021 attacked by assailants as he milked his cows with his 11 years old grandson Victor Ahimbisibwe and hit with sharp and blant objects on the head before he fell on the ground and died instantly.

 Kigezi regional police spokesperson Elly Maate says that victor rushed for help at the home of James Kananura who later reported the matter to Buyanja police station.

Maate adds that the scene of the crime has been visited by police and the deceased’s body taken to Rwakabengo health center III for a postmortem as investigations into the matter continue.

Title: Livestock Photosensitivity on the increase in Rukungiri
Content:
JAVILLA MUGABE

Livestock Farmers across the country will need to form Associations for them to be easily reached by extension workers who will to impart  knowledge regarding livestock nutrition.

This comes at a time when it has been discovered that most farmlands across the country have been invaded by plants with low nutritional value   mostly Pasparum, lantana Camala among others while some plants may be poisonous or thorny and end up injuring animals on the farm.

As a way forward, the Rukungiri District Veterinary officer Dr Johnson Ninsiima, has urged livestock farmers to form farmer groups for easy access, adding that farmers     can easily liaise with veterinary officials who would then impart skills and knowledge on livestock nutrition.

 According to Johnson there is an increase in the number of animals affected by photosensitivity.

 This is a condition whereby the animal’s skin is burnt by the sun’s ultra violet rays due to impoverished skin composition of the animal.

It happens when an animal eats lantana camala, whose contents weaken the animal’s skin.

  Dr Ninsiima advised farmers to always  keenly inspect  their farms,so as to uproot and burn invasive plants

Title: Five vie for Rukungiri district speakership
Content:
EMMANUEL MURUNGI

Five councilors are vying for the Rukungiri District council speaker seat;

The  newly elected councillors and those that were re-elected are  preparing to swear in on 24th May,

 James Turyamubona a councillor representing Kebisoni sub county on national resistance movement ticket and speaker in the outgoing council is seeking  for a second term in office for what he says is to accomplish his unfinished work.

Turyamubona noted that they have improved Bwanga stock farm by adding hybrid cattle, lobbied for   a new administrative Block and constructed new schools in their tenure.  

Albert Ahabwe Mugisha Rwamugata a newly elected district councilor representing Buyanja sub county on national resistance movement ticket noted that his call to pass development-oriented resolutions and fight corruption and embezzlement of government resources in the district has forced him to contest for the speaker seat.

Other councilors contesting for the new council speaker seat include Benon Kyarisima who represents Buhunga sub county on independent ticket, Susan Abinsinguza who represents youth on national resistance movement ticket and Gideon Ntungura who represents Bwambara sub county on national resistance movement ticket.

Title: Kasese resident nabbed with 3 suspected stolen motorcycles
Content:
Police in Kasese are holding a man who was found with three motorcycles but without any document that confirms him to be the rightful owner.

ASP Nelson Tumushime the Police spokesperson for Rwenzori East region says Vincent Tumusiime, a resident of Katadoba cell in Kasese municipality was found with three Bajaj Boxers registration numbers UET 256G, UEM 215Q and UEG 647F.

Tumushime cautioned all garage owners against cutting any motorcycle into spare parts without first knowing its origin, saying they will be taken as suspects if found.

 Ahmed Amini the chairperson of boda boda riders in Kasese district asserts that the accused was caught trying to sell one of the motorcycles but on condition that whoever buys it must cut it into spare parts,  

Amini added that in only march and April 2021, eleven motorcycles have been stolen from Kasese and only two recovered.

 He revealed that according to the information he got from URA,onemotorcycle is from kakuto-Rakai district, another one from kakoba Mbarara and another one from Mayuge district.

The suspect is being held at Kasese central police station.

Title: 22 held in Kabale for entering Uganda illegally
Content:
Kabale police is holding 22 non citizens for   entering Uganda illegally.

Elly Maate the Kigezi region Police PRO says they were arrested on a tip off from different bus companies this morning of 11/05/2021 at Nyakijumba check point along Kabale Mbarara highway heading to Buganda region for casual labour.

There are 14 Rwandan nationals and 8 Congolese, non of whom had relevant travel/ movement documents an indication that they entered through porous boarder entry points.

For security reasons, they are being interrogated, after which will be arraigned before courts of law to be charged accordingly.

Title: Accident Claims One in Rukungiri.
Content:
One person was this morning Killed on the spot while another sustained grievous injuring in a fatal accident that occurred at Kinyasaano along the Rukungiri Kanungu Road.

Elly maate the Kigezi region Police PRO says the Accident involving Motor Veichle Registration Number UBH 283E, a Blue Mitsubishi Canter and a Red Motor Cycle Number UEU 641M Bajaj Boxer   claimed   Amil Bright 33yrs a passenger on the motorcycle and resident of Kihani cell Nyankwanzi s/county, Mwenge county Kyenjojo district.  

The rider one Asiimwe Medard was rushed to Nyakibale hospital in critical condition.

Police visited the scene, and took the body to Rwakabego health centre mortuary pending post-mortem.

The Motor veichle and motor cycle have been towed and parked at Rukungiri police station and inquiries initiated to establish the likely cause of the accident.

Title: Make Use Of Extension Workers; Rukungiri District Production Officer
Content:
As the country continues to face an unprecedented change in weather patterns, farmers have been asked to seek advice from extension workers in order to sustainably benefit from their farming. 

According to the Rukungiri district Production Officer, Mr Zepher Karyeija Byarugaba, farmers should run their activities according to the prevailing weather conditions rather than following the traditional   prediction systems for    weather patterns

He said    it is now difficult for farmers to determine which month will receive more rainfall or sunshine, which all have a great impact on farming activities,  

 Mr Karyeija said that as the district continues to receive rainfall, crops like maize, beans, bananas and coffee have among others seen an increase in pests and diseases and thus the need for agronomic assistance from qualified extension workers.

According to The District Forestry Officer Mr. Twinomujuni Arthur, a change in weather patterns is caused by human activities  .  

However, Mr Zepher Karyeija said that each sub county in Rukungiri district has got qualified extension workers and therefore urged farmers to make use of them to get advice on crop husbandry especially in fighting pests, diseases and chosing the right farm inputs.

Title: Kasese Policeman detained  for Murdering wife.
Content:
Police in Kasese are holding one of their own corporal Nickson Kamala Sadiqui for shooting and killing his wife.

The incident happened on Thursday evening at around 6pm at good life trading center in Bulambira cell, Bulambira ward Rugendabara town council, where the deceased operated  a shop.

 ASP Nelson Tumushime the police spokesperson for Rwenzori East Region said that the suspect is attached to Rubirizi central police station but he has been detained at Kasese central police station and   will be taken to court.

The deceased has been identified as Zubedha Muhindo 28 year’s old. Tumushime advised men and women in uniform to always seek for counseling whenever they are faced with domestic challenges.

Edison Kule the chairperson of that area says that the duo had separated for six years and Muhindo had gotten married to another man, but kamala has been threatening to kill her if she doesn’t go back to his home.

 Joseph Thembo, one of the witnesses says the suspect first shot in the air sending residents scampering for safety before turning the gun to his wife.

Title: Rukungiri farmers advised on Micro scale irrigation.
Content:
Failure by Farmers to get involved in Government programs has been blamed for the slow improvement of house hold incomes.

This is according to the Rukungiri District Principle Agriculture Officer Mr Kwesiga Pius Oneck who also urged farmers to   take advantage of Government programs in order to produce more quality products that would in turn improve their livelihoods.

Mr. Oneck gave an example of the Micro-scale Irrigation Program,which he said is majorly meant to improve farmers livelihood through Irrigation whereby a farmer can grow crops three seasons a year by irrigating crops during the dry season.

According to Oneck, in the program which started a year ago, the Government provides farmers with Irrigation equipment by paying up to 75% of the purchase cost while the farmer ultimately owns the equipment.

However, the program has not  attracted  the targeted   farmer involvement in the first year as compared to other Government programs .  

He also urged extension workers at sub county level to work with zeal, and mobilize farmers about current Government programs

Title: 10 teenage pregnancies registered daily in Kabale  district.
Content:
Kabale district has registered 600 cases of teenage pregnancies in the last two months in a trend that is worrying officials. 

Simply put more than 10 girls under the age of 18 get pregnant on daily basis in the southwestern district.

Monica Muhumuza Nzeirwe, Kabale District Probation Officer says her office recorded 1,867 cases of girls aged under 18 who were defiled and made pregnant between March 2020-March 2021.
Muhumuza says that the cases include a 14-year-old girl from Kitooma parish, Rubaya sub-county who completed primary seven and was chased from home after it was discovered by her parents that she is pregnant. 

Muhumuza says that because the minor was raped by two men who later took off, and she cannot who is responsible for her pregnancy.

Muhumuza says that the current level of cases is unprecedented. 
  
According to Muhumuza, the increase of cases resulted from redundancy that children especially girl child experienced during Covid-19 lockdown. She says that because there was no academic pressure, most girl children assumed they were mature enough and started getting involved in sexual acts. 

Martin Kasagara Kiiza, the Executive Director of the National Children Authority (NCA), a department under the Ministry of Gender, Labor and Social Development responsible for monitoring the progress of all investigations and criminal proceedings relating to children, says that due to increase of cases, they have embarked on laying strategies with media to educate the masses about the dangers of early pregnancies and how they can be avoided. 

Kasagara also says that they are liaising with district officials to make sure that parents get enough sensitization on how to protect their children from sexual abuses.

Title: Baryomunsi distances himself as rift in church over donation takes new twist.
Content:
Kinkiizi East Mp Dr Chris Baryomunsi has refuted claims that he was behind the impounding of iron sheets that He donated to Kashayo church of Uganda in Rugyeyo Sub County in Kanungu District.

The Uganda Police Force over the weekend returned and handed over the 252 Iron sheets it had impounded from Kashayo COU under the Diocese of Kinkizi.

According to the Uganda Police CID Spokesman Charles Twine, the impounded iron sheets had been subject to investigations.

Dr Baryomunsi while responding to reports that his complaint to Police was the basis of an investigation in which church leaders were interrogated said he never complained to police and those making the claim should have inquired from police about the source of the complaint.

He said he has no problem with the iron sheets being returned to the Church since he had donated them to the Church to do God’s work.

Dr Baryomunsi says he hoped the church leaders do not sell the iron sheets again and share the money.

The issue of the irons sheets which were donated by the Area MP Baryomunsi on 1st March 2020 has been contentious as the church leaders did don’t put them to use but instead used others brought later in in fulfilment of a pledge by businessman James Musinguzi Garuga.

It's reported that around early 2019, businessman James Musinguzi Garuga pledged factory measured iron sheets.

Before he could deliver them, the Kinkizi East Member of Parliament Dr Chris Baryomunsi also visited the same church on promised to deliver the iron sheets which he promptly did within 2 days on 3rd 2020, but they were not put to use and instead the church administration under the then Ven Rev Enos Mukombe waited for James Musinguzi Garuga's iron sheets which were instead used to roof the church.

The reasons behind this move by the church leaders were not given, a complaint to Police was lodged sparking off in investigation into allegations that the church leaders had sold the iron sheets and shared the money.

Title: Pictorial, Rukungiri Municipal leaders swear in.
Rukungiri Municipality swears in new Speaker.
Content:
Obadiah Twinomuhwezi

Constance Tumusime (Kagashe ward) is the duly elected speaker for Rukungiri municipality defeating Emmy Turyabagyenyi  the first contender with fourteen votes against thirteen while one vote was invalid.

The voting took place this morning at Lorycon Inn in western division Rukungiri municipality.

Speaking after taking the oath Ms Tumusime who doubles as a primary school teacher pledged cooperation and unity in the council for a common goal.

Tumusime will be deputized by Boaz Kamusiime a youth councilor who who emerged winner against Ms Mark Sulait Turyamureeba of kitimba ward.

The function at Lorrycon Hotel in Rukungiri Municiplaity started with the swearing in of the Rukungiri Municipality Mayor Charles Makuru   for the next five year term of office.

 Makuru and his council also took their oath to serve in the capacities they were elected in.

The Swearing-in ceremony was presided over by Hajji Badru Mayanja, the Rukungiri Municipality town clerk

Title: Rukungiri district leaders take oath of office.
Content:
Rukungiri District Chairman Geoffery Kyomukama and his council yesterday took oath of office.

The swearing-in ceremony was presided over by the Rukungiri district chief magistrate His worship Nasuru Ntaro Hassan   at Rukungiri inn, Eastern Division Rukungiri Municipality.

Ntaro advised the Councillors to avoid misuse of office and only concentrate on the development of the district  

He also added that they must be transparent and ready to show proper accountability to the people they serve.

Goffery kyomukama the new district chairperson says he aims at creating employment for the increasing population in the district, improve household income, properly implement government programs and improve   health and education  

 
At the same function James Turyamuboona, the male district councillor was elected unopposed as district speaker unopposed while Frank Karezi the Rwerere town council District councillor was elected as the deputy speaker.

Satrinah Nahwera the district woman councillor of Buhunga and Ruhinda sub counties has been appointed the district vice chairperson  

The district executive committee was also unveiled in which Gideon Ntungura from Bwambara is in charge of finance planning, Mathias Mwesigwa Rwabugumi is in charge of Health and Nutrition, Cledonia Bakyironda for education and sports and Micheal Byarugaba is in charge of marketing and production.

Prof.Mondo kagonyera the former Rubabo county legislator who was the chief guest at the function asked the district chairperson and his councilors to focus on skilling the youth for them to earn   incomes so that the government can help them having started their own small-scale projects.

The Rukungiri RDC Nsubuga Bewayo also warned councilors to desist from corruption   and that they should work on the will of their voters so that they can develop this district. 

Some of the district councilors told our reporter that they are more than ready to work for the people so that they can develop their communities.

Title: Mbarara airfield to be upgraded to international airport.
Content:
By Frederick Anyine

Nyakishara airdrome Mbarara located in south western Uganda is to be upgraded to an international airport.

The construction works  that will expand the landing strip  to   3 km from 1.6 km shall be executed by the China State Construction Engineering Corporation NSCEC in partnership with Base 7 International Aviation Academy the contractor of the project on behalf of the government of Uganda.

According to Ham Kamuntu the Director General of Base 7 International Aviation Academy says their role is to provide the land and   infrastructure on behalf of the government of Uganda.

A Chinese construction company team identified as China State
Construction Engineering Corporation NSCEC visited and appreciated the  strategic location of the planned airport and promised to start the reconstruction and expansion of Nyakisharara airdrome Mbarara to an international airport after making a memorandum of understanding with the government.

The Chinese team was led in the tour by the former Mayor Mbarara
Wilson Tumwine witnessed by the Mbarara City Clerk Tibihika
Theophelous with his technical team and the Senior Marketing Manager China State Construction Engineering Corporation NSCEC Mr Konal,Xu.

Title: Makuru optimistic about new term as Rukungiri Municipal mayor.
Content:
By Obadiah Twinomuhwezi

The outbreak of Covid 19,financial reforms and lack of staff supervisory vehicles have been singled out as some of the challenges that affected the implementation of the Rukungiri municipal council budget in the previous term.

The rukungiri Municipality mayor his worship Charles Makuru who spoke to us at his office on Tuesday noted that the introduction of financial reforms directing Municipal Councils to bank the revenue collected as consolidated fund has made planning hard because the council initially budgeted for the local revenue collections.

The issue of bus-park and taxi-park re-centralization also reduced revenue collections for the Municipality.

Makuru added that inadequate transport sources inform of vehicles for municipal staff has made the supervision of some projects difficult.

Rukungiri municipal council for the last five years managed to score some achievements like the installation of powerful solar power security lights along Karegyesa road, Construction of abattoirs at Nyamayenje and Kagunga markets, upgrading Kitimba Health Centre 11 to 111 as well as establishing a micro scale irrigation scheme in Southern division to improve food production

Makuru commended the outgoing councilors for the effort and developmental ideas rendered to the council and challenged newly sworn in councilors to be the ambassadors of their electorate through raising issues affecting communities for proper possible solutions and urged them to cooperate, be vibrant and work hard in order to have a successful council and a developed municipality.

Title: Kabale ODPP launches child friendly room to boost access to justice.
Content:
KABALE

By Obed Kankiriho.

The resident judge for Kabale high court Moses Kazibwe has today launched a child friendly room in the office of the directorate of public prosecution [ODDP] in Kabale district.

While at the launch, Kazibwe said that the child friendly room was established with funding from the justice law and order sector and the children at risk action network [CRANE]

CRANE was founded in 2003 and officially registered in 2004, by a small number of Christian organisations who were working in Kampala to rescue children from the streets and from abuse.

He said that the room is going to be the reception and handling space for child victims and witnesses before appearing in courts of law, an interview room for child victims and witnesses, and a room for emotional healing.

He also stressed that as the office of the directorate of public prosecution, they have been facing a challenge of children fearing to speak out and giving evidence  

He noted that children fear to face perpetrators of crimes committed against them  

Justice Kazibwe said that the room will help children speak out, give evidence and greatly enhance juvenile justice both for the victims and those against the law.

Kazibwe further pledged on behalf of Kabale high court to embrace the use of the launched room calling upon all players in the sector to make use of the room for the enhancement and betterment of children’s justice.

Title: West Ankole diocese suspends priest over illegal wedding.
Content:
West Ankole Diocese Bushenyi district has suspended Rev Canon Johnmark Nsasiirwe, the priest of St James Church of Uganda, Kaburengye Parish for  participating in an illegal wedding.

According to a letter written by the West Ankole Diocesan Secretary, Rev Didas Natweta to Canon Nsasiirwe dated May 18, 2021, , Canon Nsasiirwe allegedly participated in an illegal church wedding ceremony and allowed it to take place at Kaburengye without adhering to the marriage laws of Uganda.

Rev Canon Nsasiirwe is accused of allowing a wedding ceremony between the former West Ankole Diocesan Dean, Rev Canon Nobert Tibikoma and his wife, Evaline Kyampaire, which occurred on May 13, 2021 at Kaburengye.

 The two persons wedded were reportedly not formally registered at least three weeks before and that, instead, they were put in the register after the wedding.

According to the Diocesan Secretary, Canon Nsasiirwe instructed the Curate and the lay reader to fraudulently sign the banns of marriage against the dates of the three Sundays as if they were actually announced before the couple’s wedding in Church when they never did.

 The authorities at Bweranyangi maintained in the letter that whereas the Curate and Lay reader admitted the wrong and asked for forgiveness, their Canon Nsasiirwe did not show any concern and remorse and instead insisted that the banns of marriage were published and there was no wrong committed.

Title: Kyabahanga Bridge; new opportunities unlocked for Rukungiri and Kanungu districts.
Content:
By OBADIAH  TWINOMUHWEEZI TUKAHIIRWA SABSON

Residents of   Nyamirama Subcounty in Kanungu district   Bwambara subcounty in Rukungiri district now have a reason to look forward with optimism following the construction of Kyabahanga bridge that will ease transport between the two sub counties and districts respectively  

The 10.5 billion Kyabahanga bridge project has been under construction since 2019 by Armpass Technical services limited.

 Locals say the new bridge reduces the cost of   agricultural produce   between the two districts

 The beneficiaries further added that a temporary bridge that existed many years ago had put the lives of the residents at a risk especially during the rainy season.

According to residents, the bridge did not only affect farmers and traders but as well affected education since students refused to go to school during the rainy season for fear of drowning.

 Earlier this month, MS Peace Agnes the managing director of Armpass Technical services during a meeting with stake holders of the two districts assured them that the bridge will be fully refurbished and handed over to the ministry of works by the end of May this year.

The Kinkiizi West member of parliament James Kaberuka expects the bridge to improve on the tourism sector as well as motivating residents to carry out extensive agriculture because transport costs to and from the markets will be minimized.

Title: Pictorial, Nyiragongo volcano erupts
Content:
Nyiragongo volcano also known as Nyilagongo an active volcano in the Virunga ranges has erupted

The volcano is found in the eastern DR Congo just 10 km from Goma city

Mount Nyiragongo in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo,which is  one of the world's most active volcanoes, erupted on Saturday, sending panicked residents of the nearby city of Goma fleeing, although a volcanologist said the city did not appear to be in danger.

People grabbed mattresses and other belongings and fled towards the frontier with neighbouring Rwanda as a red glow filled the sky above the city. Power was out across much of the city

Title: NRM CEC rejects  Kadaga, Tips Oulanya for Speakership
Content:
NRM central executive committee has endorsed Hon. Jacob Oulanyah as the party's candidate for speakership of the 11th parliament.
According to sources, Kadaga lost the majority vote.
This however does not make Oulanyah the preferred choice for a speaker for the NRM as the CEC will only recommend to the caucus their choice of candidate for deliberations and adoption in case there is agreement.


The NRM caucus sitting at Entebbe will later today vote for the party candidate for the Speakership race.
The NRM candidate will face that has also attracted Ibrahim Ssemuju Nganda from The FDC

Title: Kadaga breaks ranks with party, to contest for speakership as independent.
Content:
Kamuli Woman MP Rebecca Alitwaala Kadaga has broken ranks with her party and vowed to stand as an Independent candidate for the position of Speaker of Parliament.
She made her declaration on sunday evening in a televised press conference held in kampala.
The development came hours after the ruling National Resistance Movement’s (NRM) Central Executive Committee (CEC) resolved to endorse Jacob Oulanya as Speaker of Parliament.
The party caucus also endorsed the CEC recommendation that Jacob Oulanyah becomes the speaker candidate for the party.
The vote was unanimous to support CEC’s recommendation after a heated debate over two days, after many months of covert campaigning.

The caucus also endorsed Hon. Anita Annet Among as NRM's choice for Deputy Speaker of Parliament after beating Hon. Thomas Bangirana Tayebwa in the caucus vote.
Kadaga had expressed worries about CEC’s heavy involvement in determining the top positions in Parliament, saying the matter should be put to vote.
But party stalwarts including Ruth Nankabirwa reminded Kadaga that her rise to the position of Speaker was endorsed by CEC.
The elections for Speaker of 11th Parliament will be held at Kololo ceremonial grounds tomorrow, Monday
The election will be presided over by Chief Justice Owiny Dollo.
Kadaga will now face Oulanya, who has already received the support of the ruling party which has majority lawmakers in Parliament.
She asked Ugandans to rally their lawmakers to vote wisely during tomorrow’s election at Kololo.

Title: Oulanyah in;Kadaga out!
Content:
Omoro County MP Jacob Oulanyah has been voted in as the new speaker of parliament.

Oulanyah will lead the 11th parliament whose first order of business was voting on the speaker position.

Oulanyah was in a tight race for the position with fellow NRM big wig Rebecca Kadaga.

Kadaga has been the speaker of parliament since 2011 and was contesting for a third term.

Oulanyah beat Kadaga to the prized position garnering 310 votes to Kadaga’s 197 votes. FDC candidate Ssemujju Nganda trailed with 15 votes.

Oulanyah who has been deputy Speaker for 10 years will now be in charge of affairs at the August House for the next five years, a position he missed out narrowly after stepping down for Kadaga on advice of the Central Executive Committee, the ruling NRM party’s top organ.

On Sunday, CEC endorsed Oulanyah to come unopposed as the party flag bearer but Kadaga decided to stand on the independent ticket.

Title: Rukungiri DVO allays fears over livestock census
Content:
By Javilla Mugabe.

The Rukungiri District Veterinary Officer Mr. Ninsiima Johnson has  allayed fears expressed by  livestock farmers who are worried  that the National Livestock Census is a basis  for levying taxes on them by the Government, 

According to Ninsiima Johnson the Livestock Census is meant to collect data regarding livestock in the country for  policy and planning purposes adding that farmers should provide the right data regarding the animals they rear to make the exercise successful.

However,unlike  districts which lie in the  cattle corridor, Rukungiri district being in the non-cattle corridor will be handled through selected villages and families as samples.

According to the Technical Supervisor of the National Livestock Census for Rukungiri District Mr. Tumuheirwe Christopher, enumerators will be adorned  in light green aprons for easy Identification and will be holding appointment letters from the Ministry of Agriculture, Animal Industry and Fisheries, and thus called upon farmers to stay away from fraudsters.

He also emphasized that the exercise is aimed at obtaining the structure of livestock within the country for easy and effective  accountability.

The exercise which started yesterday will be conducted within 162 selected villages in Rukungiri District up to 4th June 2021.

Title: Father of 18 year old dies at 30
Content:
A man who became father at 12 years has died aged 30.

Mr Ben Baherezibwa who   succumbed to intestinal complications resulting from long Ulcers infection at his home in Kirama, Rukoni parish Kibatsi sub county on Monday and was laid to rest on Tuesday afternoon.

Baherezibwa a salon operator produced his first child when he was in Primary 6 from a girl who was in S.3 at the time.

Ms Violet Baherezibwa the mother to the late said his son was a miracle father who never fell back even after giving birth to his first child.

He left two children,

His son Jordan Natumanya 18, described his father as a caring man who loved his children and would counsel them whenever they had challenges.

Ms Baherezibwa said his son had an intestinal illness which he acquired after working in South Sudan for months.

He stayed with the complication for over three years going to and from hospital. At the time of his death he had been hospitalized at Mbarara regional referral hospital where multiple tests were done including the test for cancer but the results returned negative.

His elder brother Mr Edson Baherezibwa who is the Uganda red cross society head of volunteer services castigated the health services for failure to operate to standards especially providing essential medicines to patients in there living them to die in hospitals which he says are like lodges where patients are only given beds to sleep.

Title: Lock-down looming as ICUs get overwhelmed
Content:
The Ministry of health permanent secretary Dr Diana Atwine is calling for the urgent lock-down of some areas to counter the rising covid19 cases, .

Dr Atwine says some areas need to be urgently locked down if the covid-19 second wave is to be contained since people have refused to  observe SOPs   

 Dr Atwine says they are soon going to engage with the president after thorough consultations with the experts for guidance.

According to Dr Atwine, the second wave is worsening adding that the Intensive Care Units are already full with public hospitals soon running out of space to accommodate patients.

Atwine says the situation is worrying since the majority of the new infection are from young people.
