Title: District leaders  tasked on HIV/AIDS activities in Covid-19  Pandemic
Content:
District leaders have been tasked to integrate covid 19 in subsequent programs of the district Especially HIV services.

The call has been made by Uganda AIDS commission in the trainings aimed at Building the capacity of District Aids Committees in the country.

In western region and Kigezi sub region to be specific, training has been conducted in districts of Rubanda, Kabale, Kisoro, Rukiga, Rukungiri, Mitooma, Kanungu and Ntungamo.

The Director Policy Research and Programming at Uganda AIDS Commission Dr. Zephar Karyabakabo advised members of the Districts AIDS Committees (DACs) to align District HIV Strategic Plan to National HIV/AIDS Strategic Plan 2020/21 – 2024/25, Mainstream HIV and Covid 19 Activities in district programs and ensure there is reduced stigma for people living with HIV/AIDS.

Training follows issuance of updated guidelines on infection and prevention and control of HIV Services with in COVID – 19 Era generated in March 2020 and updated in December 2020.

The guidelines call on all health facilities to ensure continuous ART therapy Provision to current recipients, documentation of clients for easy follow up amidst Covid 19 Pandemic.

Title: Rukungiri teachers trained on Covid-19 SOPs
Content:
Mugabe Robert

65 Primary School Teachers in Rukungiri Municipality have been trained to enhance COVID-19 Preventation measures, Guidance and Counseling , Hygiene and Sanitation.

The Rukungiri Municipality Education Department yesterday    conducted a one day training  seminar at Nyakibale Upper Boarding P/School in preparation for the reporting of P.1, P.2 and P.3 on 7th June 2021

The lowe primary section has stayed home since the beginning of COVID-19 pandemic out break.

The Municipal Principal education officer Alfred Katabazi Mutuza said that P.1, P.2 and P.3 classes accommodate the largest numbers which need much attention and care  and this has  forced the department to train that will dubbed COVID-19 Task forces at Schools

He further asked parents to monitor and accept advice from their children because the trained teachers will also train pupils at school.

The Health Specialist Arinaitwe Julius trained teachers on school operating standards among others the use of safe water, Food hygiene, and Sanitation  

The Municipal Education Officer in charge of Guidance and Counseling Mwesigwa Patience appealed to teachers to always  befriend their pupils  and study their problems  to be able to help them.

Title: Low funding affecting HIV/AIDS activities in Ntungamo
Content:
People living with HIV/AIDS (PLHIV) in  Ntungamo District have decried the  low HIV/AIDS activity funding which has exacerbated the continued spread of the scourge across the country.

This is after donors stopped  funding   some of the HIV/AIDS activities in Ntungamo district  .

According to Natukunda Peace Kaconco the focal person of People Living with HIV/AIDS in Ntungamo District low HIV funding has crippled their activities towards reducing the scourge, noting that it is paramount for the district to mainstream HIV/AIDS activities in their financial budgets.

She made remarks on Wednesday during the unveiling of the National HIV/AIDS strategic Plan 2020/21-2024/2025 in the Ntungamo district Board room by the Uganda Aids Commission under the theme,” Ending the HIV/AIDS epidemic: Communities at the forefront”.

The Ntungamo District health Educator Twesigye Nesterio also attributed the increase of HIV/AIDS in the district to non functional of district HIV/AIDS committees and sub county AIDS coordination committees due to lack of adequate funding.

However, the director of policy, Research and programing at Uganda AIDS Commission Dr Zepher Karyabakaabo  assured People Living with HIV/AIDS that the government has already directed to all accounting officers to allocate 0.1% of annual operational budgets towards mainstreaming HIV interventions in their respective sectors and creation of one Dollar initiative which is expected to generate additional funding from private sector.

Title: Gen Katumba Wamala survives assassination attempt
Content:
Out going works minister General Edward Katumba wamala narrowly survived death this morning after gunmen sprayed his car with bullets that instantly killed his daughter and driver.

Gen Katumba Wamala was reportedly trailed by gunmen riding on two bodabodas.They reportedly hired the boda bodas from Kisasi stage.

His vehicle bears several bullet holes.

Gen Katumba Wamala's daughter Brenda Nantongo and his driver, Haruna Kayondo were killed in the morning attack as the General left his home in Bukoto.

Title: Nyakishenyi residents worried as witchcraft takes root.
Content:
Residents of Ngoma and Kahoko parishes in Nyakyishenyi sub county Rukungiri district have raised concern over the increasing cases of witchcraft in their area

The perpetrators are reportedly using herbal concoctions to cast spells on their victims and children  

  Silver Byamugisha   the local council One chairperson Kayabuteya cell in Ngoma parish, on Monday night grabbed a suspect at his home and took him to Rwakaraba police post for further investigation.

The suspect whose names were with held told residents and police that he is from Bunyaruguru and he was brought by a resident of Ngoma parish who is also in police custody now.

Mariciyari Orimutunga Batipu and Jane Tumugabirwe parish councilors of Ngoma parish  appealed to the to residents to desist from witch craft and instead to uplift their standards of living.

Residents told our reporters that witchcraft has affected both education of their children and marriages in their families .

Title: Rukungiri water shortage blamed on poor agro-forestry practices
Content:
By Robert Mugabe

The current Shortage of water in Rukungiri has been attributed to the farmers who plant eucalyptus trees near  water sources within a range of 30metres  .

It is said that one eucalyptus tree can consume at least 20 litres a day which   reduces the volume of water and lowers the water table.

 The District Water Officer Twekwase Deus said that there a need to implement   laws aimed at  preserving  water sources  

He asked farmers who have planted tees along  Kahengye River to remove them as early possible.

Title: Kebisoni residents up in arms over Kahengye project compensation.
Content:
BY Robert Mugabe.

Residents of Nyebingo, in Kebisoni subcounty Rukungiri District who were affected by the The Kahengye water project have threatened to petition the IGG over what they call an unjust compensation process.

They say the project which involved digging through their land affected their gardens, but the money they were paid in compensation does not tally with the valuation that was carried out.

Joseph Mutebi, an elder in Butinde Nyeibingo says   valuation was done successfully and damage to his property was valued at shs 13million but he was paid only shs 1.7million.

Canon Joy Mujuni of Kagyeyo Nyeibingo says her property was valued at shs 40million but she was paid only 620,000=  

The kahengye water project is a world bank funded project that is aimed at improving water supply to Rukungiri Municipality and the surrounding areas.

The Rukungiri District Water Officer Twekwase Deus says that there were some adjustments in the valuation  process but all  appropriate payments will be made.

Title: Domestic violence; more Male victims being recorded in Rukungiri
Content:
JACKIE TUMUHEIRWE

 A section leaders in Rukungiri district is worried over the rampant harassment including beating, of men by their wives, noting that if the situation doesn’t change, families will be no more.

The leaders were yesterday speaking at a reflection meeting about the Women’s Empowerment and Leadership Project (WELP), a project of Forum for Women in Democracy (FOWODE), which took place at Platinum Classic Suites Buyanja.

Michael Byarugaba, the district Production, Marketing and natural resources officer noted that in the past, men used to beat their wives,  but it’s the reverse these days.

Gideon Ntungura, the district councilor representing Bwambara Sub County, and also secretary for Finance, Planning and Administration, proposed that for families to be stable, men too should be empowered, religious leaders should get involved in sensitization, as well as women respecting the fact that they can never be above their husbands.

Prima Mubangizi, however said there are reasons women beat their husbands, noting that some have neglected their families. She proposed that councils pass an ordinance on  opening  bars in the evening hours, so that men are compelled to work before going to bars.

The district chief administrative officer, Erias Byamungu is optimistic that if children are raised responsibly, the challenge of domestic violence will be unheard of in the near future, since the same children will form responsible families.

Title: Buyanja Sub County LC iii Chairman Calls For Community Service To Save Roads
Content:
By JAVILLA MUGABE

The Local Council Three Chairperson for Buyanja Sub county in Rukungiri District Mr Agaba Emmy Rubondo has identified community service by residents as the easiest means to maintain community roads.
This was in response to increased outcry among residents of Kihengamo cell,Rubanga parish,Buyanja sub county over poor roads which they blame for hindering transportation of their products to the market.

The area LCI chairman Mr Crenario Bakacwa,wants the sub county council to prioritize renovation of the road.He said the area produces at least 500 bunches of bananas while others are wasted in the area due to difficult transportation to the market.He said the road was last renovated in 2018 and since then it has been compromised by rains over time.

Abeho Fudeli a resident of the area who talked to our reporter emphasized that the area is endowed with a variety of food items that include maize,bananas and coffee,but dont get good prices due to poor roads.He wants leaders to lobby funds from Government so that the road can be improved.

In response,Agaba Emmy Rubondo, the LC 111 Chairman,revealed that the road is already in consideration and will be renovated in the next financial year.However,he urged residents to join hands with their leaders at village levels and do community service so that they can maintain structures like roads.

According to Emmy Rubondo roads take a lot of taxpayers' money to maintain and renovate,and sometimes they can be easily destroyed especially during the rainy season but when there timely and regular community service,they can be maintained.

Title: South Africa vs Uganda: Coach tests positive for COVID-19, clash in serious doubt
Content:
Tournament: International Friendly
Match: South Africa Vs Uganda Cranes
Date: June 10, 2021
Venue: Orlando Stadium in Soweto
Kickoff: 7:00 pm (EAT)

South Africa-S.A is scheduled to host Uganda today Thursday in an international friendly at Orlando Stadium in Soweto.

However according to the latest reports coming through on Boona Fm news desk leaves the match in a doubt.

Reports have it that the S.A’s national team, Bafana Bafana’s assistant coach Janevski Cedomir has tested positive for the deadly virus COVID-19.

The Macedonian tested positive after the second COVID-19 tests carried out on Tuesday.
According to World Health Organization, this match has to be postponed because Janevski was in contact with his players. However, South African Football Federation- SAFA insists that the game will take place today evening since most of the players tested negative on Tuesday.

Bafana Bafana will also miss the services of their newly appointed head coach Hugo Broos who is in Belgium for vaccination and players Percy Tau, Teboho Mokoena, and Sipho Mbule who tested positive for Covid-19 early this week.

Title: South Africa 3-2 Uganda:  Bafana Bafana comes from behind to punish Cranes
Content:
Uganda Cranes was ahead by halftime as the Vipers midfielder Ibrahim Orit scored in the 17th minutes after kickoff.

Bafana Bafana came from behind to win the much anticipated international friend, beating Cranes 3-2 on Thursday.

Baroka Fc midfielder Evidence Makgopa leveled for Bafana Bafana in the 62nd minutes. Maritzburg Utd player Bongokuhle Hlongwane doubled the lead 22nd minutes into the second half. Evidence Makgopa booked his brace in the 83rd minute.

Forward Lumala Abdu’s in the 89th minute couldn’t save the cranes from being punished in South Africa.

“I want to thank God that we finished the game successfully today without any serious injuries and I believe we have seen that we have a lot to do in the coming months so that we be ready for 2022 World Cup qualifiers. And there are so many positives that we can look at today, we have seen so many good players, new players into the team that we can build to have a strong team,” Cranes Captain Emmanuel Okwi said after the disappointing result.

“It was completely too deferent halves, so we have a very beautiful game in the first half. We had shots on goal and we had a lead in the first half. Second half we switched off and then we were punished.” – Cranes coach Abdullah Mubiru on the lose to Bafana Bafana.

Title: Testing positive for covid-19 should not be a secret. - Ministry of Health.

  • 47, 760 people have recovered in  Uganda while 757, 664 people have been vaccinated in Uganda.
  • 1, 168, 479 Covid-19 tests have been conducted in Uganda. 
  •  From June 1 to June 10, a total of 38 Covid-19 deaths were registered and over 8,273 confirmed new cases.

After recording 1,438 new Covid-19 cases on Thursday, June 10, Uganda's highest record in a day since the outbreak was confirmed, the Ministry of Health has argued the public not to make positive results for covid -19 a secret.

"Hiding your positive results can lead to the loss of your near and dear ones. Inform your close contacts when you test positive to enable them to take necessary precautions and avoid spreading this deadly virus to others." Ministry of Health documented.

This message finds Uganda with 56,949 Covid-19 recorded cases with at least 784 patients admitted to hospitals across the country.

According to Ministry of Health, with the first wave, one person could infect between 21 to 39 people.

But with the second wave, a positive person is likely to infect between 80 to 100 people. The government has continued to appeal to all eligible persons to go for vaccination to avert the crisis.

Title: EURO 2020: Christian Eriksen collapses on the pitch during EURO match
Content:
Christian Eriksen has collapsed on the pitch during EURO 2020 game of Denmark and Finland.

The Denmark player collapsed as a throw-in was played towards him. The players immediately called for the medical staff and Eriksen was being resuscitated at one point.

The players all looked in tears and some were praying.

Eriksen’s wife was later called down to the pitch and she has been seen being consoled by Denmark captain Simon Kjaer and goalkeeper Kasper Schmeichel.

A curtain has been put up around Christian Eriksen with no live update for his situation.

The incident happen three minutes to halftime. The referee later called off the match for halftime. According to the sources at at Parken Stadium in Denmark the match has been suspended.

Title: “Engage your children in home activates” – Ham Akampurira urges parents

Rev. Andrew Kananura the youth coordinator Rukungiri North Kigezi Diocese challenged parents to nurture their children through sharing experiences on a round table.

Kananura urged the youth to use their time profitability through revising books and participating in-home activities for a better tomorrow.

Title: COVID-19 surge in Kabale
Content:
Weeks, Kabale district recorded over 65 Positive cases of COVID 19 according to Dr. Paddy Mwesigye, the assistant Kabale district health officer in charge of maternal health.

Speaking to our reporter, Paddy said that within a period of two weeks, 311 people in Kabale district tested positive for COVID 19, 70 are in hospital, 246 receiving home-based care services and 15 are on Oxygen cylinders.

Paddy urged the public to avoid overcrowding, burial events, stay in their homes, and observe standard operating procedures if they are to prevent coronavirus.

Darius Nandinda, the Kabale resident district commissioner expressed a concern about COVID-19 home based care patients stressing that  patients are not observing SOPs posing an increase the covid-19 cases.

He further cautioned business owners who don’t have handwashing facilities to do so if they don’t what their businesses to be closed

Title: Testing for COVID-19 is a necessity to everyone   - RDC Birungi Abubaker
Content:
The Rukungiri district deputy RDC Birungi Abubaker has urged the public to visit hospitals immediately in case of feeling unusual.

 Abubaker while speaking to our reporter at his office insisted that some people hesitate visting hospitals for testing and end up keeping at home because of escalating myths about the vaccine.

 He added that anybody with symptoms of COVID-19 but unwilling to check up will be penalized. He has encouraged Ugandans to continue protecting themselves from this disease by wearing masks, sanitizing frequently and avoiding large gatherings.

According to Abubaker,the  hospital providing free testing services in Rukungiri district is Rwamahwa health centre 111 located in Rukungiri Municipality.  

He therefore urged people to take advantage and test and start immediate treatment in case they are found positive.

Title: Rukungiri releases end of year promotional results
Content:
Rukungiri district has released end of year 2020 promotion examinations results for primary four and five at St Gerald’s senior secondary school.

272 primary schools both private and government participated in this district set promotional examinations.

Kyaruhotora primary school emerged as the best government performing school both in primary four and five examination, Brian trust nursery and primary school emerged as the best performing private school both in primary four and five.

Seaking at the release results, the Rukungiri district education officer Jackson Turyahumura commended head teachers and schools for vivid performances despite the lockdown that has affected learners.

He urged teachers and headteachers to prepare for learners and urged learners to revise their books during the Covid 19 lockdown holiday in order not to backslide in performance.

Obadia Muhumuza the head teacher for Kyaruhotora primary school in Nyarushanje Sub County that emerged the best performing government school attributed their success to cooperation and hard work.

Title: North Kigezi diocese bishop succumbs to Covid-19
Content:
The Anglican Church is mourning the death of Rt. Rev. Benon Magezi, the bishop of North Kigezi Diocese.

The Diocesan Secretary, Rev. Enock Karamuzi confirmed his death at 10:15pm on Tuesday from Mulago National Referral Hospital. The DS, describes the fallen bishop as hard-working, developmental, and one who loved and cared for his staff regardless of their positions.

Bishop Benon Magezi was consecrated and enthroned as bishop on 8th January 2017 at Emmanuel Kinyasaano. He had recently launched a major fundraising campaign to expand the cathedral, which is already under construction. The bishop before the second lockdown had set 20th June as the date to celebrate 40 years of the diocese.

Prior to his election as Bishop, he served as Diocesan Treasurer of North Kigezi Diocese, and in many parishes. He has ordained a deacon in December 1991 and a priest the following year. He earned a Bachelor of Divinity from the Bishop Tucker School of Divinity and Theology at Uganda Christian University, Mukono, in 2009, having earned both a Certificate and Diploma in Theology from Bishop Barham Theological College in 1990 and 1998, respectively.

While preaching recently at a burial of the late Zerida, wife to Rev Rulent of Rwakirungura in Buyanja, Bishop Magezi asked the mourners to strive to be victorious, knowing that their end is there.
At the age 61, Bishop Benon Magezi is survived by his wife, Gladys with whom they have five children

His death occurred hours after the ministry of health had released results of Covid- 19 tests done on 13 June 2021 indicating an increase in Uganda’s virus cases to 64,251 after 1,422 more Ugandans tested positive.

The ministry’s statement also indicated that 25 more Ugandans had succumbed to the virus in just 24 hours, pushing the total fatality to 459 since March last year when the virus outbreak was confirmed in the country.

Therefore, everyone is urged by Ministry of Health to observe Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) to avert the spread of the pandemic as most health facilities are full to capacity

Title: Airtel Uganda Completes Airtel Money Business Transfer to Airtel Mobile Commerce Uganda Limited
Content:
Summary
The change is in line with a Bank of Uganda's requirement to separate Airtel Money from mainstream Telecommunications Services.
Customer deposits are safe.
Transaction charges remain at the same affordable rate.
Customers will continue to access the Airtel Money Service via short code *185# or *165# or My AirtelApp, as well as our touch points and support system including; Airtel Money Agents, Service Centers and Airtel Outlets.

Kampala. Airtel Uganda, the Smartphone Network with the widest 4G coverage in Uganda, has today announced the separation of Airtel Money from its Telecom Business. Technically, the Airtel Money Business has been transferred to Airtel's affiliate, Airtel Mobile Commerce Uganda Limited("AMC Uganda").
The business separation complies with a new law – the National Payment Systems (NPS) Act, 2020 – passed on 4th September 2020, and the NPS Regulations gazetted on 5th March, 2021. Pursuant to Section 9 of the Act, the Bank of Uganda, on 24th May, 2021, announced the issuance of the following Licenses to Airtel Mobile Commerce Uganda Limited: 1). A Payment Service Provider (Class A) Licence, Number PSP 01/21, which authorizes AMC Uganda to provide Electronic (Airtel) Money Services;

2). A Payment Systems Operator Licence - (Electronic Money Systems), Number PSO 01/21, which authorizes AMC Uganda to operate a Payment (Airtel Money) Platform.

As a result of the separation, the Airtel Money Accounts and related information will be migrated or shared with the new company, with the same level of safety and protection, and in compliance with the privacy and data protection laws of Uganda and the directives of Bank of Uganda and Uganda Communications Commission.

"The customer deposits are safe, secure and kept in reputable commercial banks with the same level of protection as other bank accounts. AMC Uganda and the Commercial Banks holding the customers' funds are licensed, regulated and supervised by the Bank of Uganda," MrManoj, noted.

Customers will continue to access the Airtel Money Service via short code *185# or *165# or My AirtelApp, as well as our touch points and support system including; Airtel Money Agents, Service Centers and Airtel Outlets.

Title: Museveni Declares Friday 25 June, Public Holiday for Covid-19 National Prayers
Content:
President Museveni has declared tomorrow, Friday a public holiday but also a national day for prayers after a rise in Coronavirus infections in the country.

Uganda has recorded 74260 Covid infections and 752 deaths since March last year but in the last one month, the number of infections have increased by 17 folds whereas the number of deaths has also more than doubled.

However, according to President Museveni, Friday will be a public holiday to enable the country hold prayers to seek for God’s intervention in the ongoing Covid pandemic.The prayers will be held at State House Entebbe at mid-day but the leaders of the various religious denominations will lead the prayers via zoom.

According to a message from State House, Pastor Robert Kayanja will represent the Born Again Christians from Lubaga Miracle Centre Cathedral, Seventh-day Adventist Uganda Union, Kireka hill, Lubaga Cathedral, St, Nicholas Cathedral Namungoona for the Orthodox, All Saints Cathedral, Nakasero for Protestants and the Gadhafi National Mosque, Old Kampala for the Muslim faithful.

The president has used powers given to the President of Uganda by Section 2(2) of the Public Holidays Act to declare tomorrow a public holiday.Members of the public have been asked to attend to prayers from their homes through radios, TVs and social media channels that will relay the prayers live.

The development comes a week after President Museveni imposed a total lockdown of the country for 42 days as a measure to control the spread of the virus.“The strategy is to prevent these infections so that we have few infected people if at all. The situation can be managed by minimizing the number of infections and give urgent care for the severely ill,” Museveni said last week.

Title: Rukungiri re-tests Covid-19 Positive health workers
Content:
EMMA MURUNGI

Rukungiri district is to re-test the 28 health workers that previously tested covid 19 positive.

Stephen Nsubuga Bewayo the Rukungiri district Covid 19 taskforce chairperson says the district has been fortunate and has not registered any health worker death,

He noted that the 28 health workers that tested positives weeks ago   were   not in critical condition and were sent home for home care,

They will be retested to enable them resume work.

Nsubuga said that they have been providing health workers with protective gear and cautioning them to observe covid 19 standard operating procedures before attending to any patient in order to stem  the spread of covid 19 amongst frontline workers.

28 health workers who tested positive were replaced by health workers from health centers that are not so busy .

Title: Rukungiri Covid-19 infections reduce as lockdown enters week 2
Content:
EMMA MURUNGI

Rukungiri district Covid 19 taskforce chief Stephen Nsubuga Bewayo has confirmed that there is a reduction in  Covid 19 registered cases  as the country nears two weeks in lockdown.

Nsubuga says 158 people were tested in Rukungiri district on Sunday and Monday but only 40 tested positive  noting  that they would have registered higher infection rates if the 42 day lockdown  had not been put in  put in place.

He noted that the the district used to register many cases before lockdown even though testing was voluntary.

Nsubuga said that 80 percent of the people today observe Covid 19 standard operating procedure that’s why registered cases have reduced,

He however he noted that shop owners don’t observe curfew time   as they close at exactly 7pm yet by 7pm they are all supposed to be at their homes.

Rukungiri has as of today registered 374 cases of Covid 19, 10 deaths and 15 recoveries.

Title: Murder in Kanungu; 67 year old woman hacked to death.
Content:
Police in Kanungu are hunting for unknown assailants over the murder of Bakamubona Catherine, a  67 year old resident  of Nyabubare cell Nyamigoye parish Kanyontorogo Sub county , Kanungu district.

Elly Maate the Kigezi region police PRO says the case was reported at kanyantorogo Police station by Sunday Innocent, the chairperson LC 1  today 29/06/2021 at about 10am  concerning the murder of one old peasant woman    by unknown people.

The body of the deceased was found lying in a pool of blood inside her house with the whole head shattered, its alleged that the deceased has been staying alone in the house

Maate says the Crime scene was visited by the team of detectives Who recovered Exhibits of sticks and a stool showered with blood   inside the deceased house

The deceased’sBody has been taken to Kihihi HCIV for postmortem.

Although No arrest has made yet, Inquiries are at hand to establish the culprits and bring them to book.

Title: High turn up for Second Covid jab in Kabale
Content:
There is a high turn up of people in response to receiving the second covid 19 jab in Kabale  district according to Dr. Gilbert Maateka the medical superintendent at Rugarama Hospital in Kabale municipality.

Administration of second COVID 19 jab kicked off yesterday in Kabale district and according to Dr. Maateka at Rugarama 35 people were administered with the jab yesterday and by press time today at around 11: 30 am, over 70 people had already received their second jab.

Since May 2021, 95 COVID 19 positive cases have been registered at Rugarama hospital and among them 26 have been discharged from  home-based care, and 54 still active in-home based care.

Dr. Maateka also said that the hospital admitted 21 COVID 19 patients  of whom    14 have been discharged, one died in the last two weeks and 7 are still admitted.

He asked those taking their second jab to avoid overcrowding    vaccination centers, maintain social distance to avoid contracting the disease.

Dr. Maateka noted that it remains an individual’s choice and consent to take on the vaccine

Title: Opinion: CORONA VIRUS CRISIS;WHOSE RESPONSIBILITY TO CARE?
Content:
Fr. Mathias KWEHANGANA


We are all aware and concerned about the covid-19 crisis both in our country Uganda and the entire World. We are all in a state of fear and anxiety. The days of the week seem to have been extended since the lockdown. A day seems to be a week and a week has turned to be a month for some of us.
Our social well being has been threatened by corona virus. Some of the issues that should be considered for the well being of the person include food, clothing, shelter, education, security, medical care and other social amenities. Without proper provision of these the person may not be able to live a life worth of his or her dignity. As some Ugandans are so vulnerable as they workfrom hand to mouth, so food is an issue and an urgent item to pay attention to as already done by government. Others can not breathe and are not in an easy position to access intensive care units.

Due to logistics involved we ask, are we safe? Whose responsibility to care amidst this crisis? Is it only the government? How will Uganda cope with this crisis amidst the cancer of corruption? If there are resources will there be fair and equal distribution?
Responsibility towards others means desiring and working for the good of others: our families, the neighbors and the entire nation in the hope that they too will become receptive to goodness and its demands.
The care and concern for others means being aware of their needs. Whatever little resources available to an individual or government can be enough to benefit one's neighbors as well.

As the President put it while addressing the nation, it is not a time of convenience and comfort but a time of war and survival.
Pope Francis also puts it that " if there is a will, whatever we have never ends, On the contrary, it abounds and does not get wasted ".
Christ elevated the value of sharing resources. He said it would be considered greatly at the time of final judgment ( Matthew 25:31-46). St. James teaches that wishful behavior is useless ( James 2:14-17).
Contemporary culture seems to have lost the good and evil, yet there is real need to re-affirm that good does exist and will prevail because God is generous and acts generously ( Psalm 119:68). The good is whatever gives, protects and promotes life, brotherhood and communion.
For some of the Ugandans who have hiked the prices of, intensive care unit services, food and other household essential items due to lockdown amidst covid-19 crisis, are you promoting life?  Do you have concern for a neighbor? Is it your wish to live alone in this country? Majority of Ugandans being Christians, is this a Christian spirit?
Fellow Ugandans, remember the word of God guides thus:" the riches you get by dishonesty soon disappear, but not before they lead you into the jaws of death "(Proverbs 21:6).
In Europe and the United States of America, they have a lot riches whether acquired dishonestly or not is it helping them now? I would ask like Albert Einstein (1879-1955), a German American theoretical physicist that" How I wish that some where there existed an island for those who are wise and of good will". Do we still have wise and good willed people in Uganda to care for fellow citizens?
Albert Einstein added " insanity is doing the same thing over and over again expecting different results ". At this time of crisis more than ever, God asks each one of us to care and to be guardians of our brothers and sisters ( Genesis 4:9), to establish relationships based on mutual consideration, attentiveness to the personal well being and integral well being of others. So let each one of us be available to offer any possible assistance with in our means and make an effort to protect our lives and lives of others. St. Teresa of Calcutta advises" if you can't feed a hundred people, then just feed one". Let this be our prayer, hope and practice.
To be Christians is to live as people of hope. This is the greatest gift Christians can offer the world now. Even in the most hopeless cases, Christians must remain hopeful that God will intervene ( I Corinthians 10:13).
Let us therefore not live under fear. Negative fear paralyses all our activities and discourages us from doing what we are capable of doing for our own good and that of others. This is why our Lord Jesus Christ who is deeply aware of the devastating and debilitating effects of fear, always invites us not to be afraid ( Matthew 28:20).
Let us be people of hope praying with the Psalmist prayer of cry for help that so many troubles have fallen on us, we are close to death, we are like all others who are about to die, all our strength is gone! Lord, restore our nation, bring us back, Almighty God! Show us your mercy, and we will be saved! ( Psalms 80 and 88).


Fr. Mathias KWEHANGANA,
St. Adrian's seminary- Kabale Diocese,
Rubanda District.

Title: Traders cry out as entire trading centers are shut  over COVID-19
Content:
A section of Traders in Karisizo and Omukidandari trading centres in Buhunga Sub County Rukungiri district are counting losses following the closure of their shops by the sub county covid 19 task force. 

According to the Buhunga sub county chief Garshom  Kwizera   two people succumbed to covid 19 in Omukyidadari trading Centre and  their  contact tested Positive which forced The subcounty Covid task force to immediately close  the trading centres in which  over 10 people are under treatment on Home based care .

A section of traders in Karisizo trading center led by their chairperson Hajji Hamidu Kabwende told our reporter that a team led by the sub county chief and GISO   closed their shops without warning  

 Apulinari Tushabomwe, Kosiya, Stephen and Jane Tumuhirwe, all who are traders in Karisizo Trading center said they  had stocked bread, tomatoes and other perishables   

The Rukungiri Resident District Commissioner who also doubles as the District COVID-19 taskforce chief , Stephen Nsubuga Bewayo confirmed that the sub county Covid 19 taskforce resolved to temporarily close the centers for two weeks because people were not observing SOP’s .

Rukungiri district currently has 374 cumulative covid 19 cases, 10 deaths, and 15 recoveries in this second wave.

Title: 14 year old knocked dead in Kabale
Content:
Police in Kabale  are  investigating circumstances under which a 14 year old girl was knocked dead on wednesday morning .

The deceased , Denise Ainebyona daughter to Justus Byomuhangi of Nyamirambira B" village Kicumbi parish Kamuganguzi sub county Kabale district  was knocked dead by a speeding car reg no UBG 659 G double cabin Toyota Hilux driven by one Kitaka Abdul of Mukono.

The accident happened    along Katuna Kabale highway few meters from the deceased,s home.

Elly maate , the Kigezi region Police spokesperson says  Aineboona was riding a bicycle a few metres from her home when  she  was knocked dead.

 The driver of the vehicle did not stop until he was intercepted at Muhanga police check point.

Maate says the vehichle has been impounded and taken to   Kabale police station pending inspection.The driver of the vehicle is also in police custody

The deceased’s  body was handed over to relatives for burial as inquiries into the matter  are ongoing.

Title: Nyarushanje Subcounty petitions  for Health Facility
Content:
Residents of Nyarushanje Subcounty   in Rukungiri district have petitioned  the ministry of health through the district administration to construct for them a Public health centre four facility, due to increased demand for health services.

Members of the Public say they   cannot afford dues charged by private hospitals around them.

Michael Musiime, the Chairperson Lc3 Myarushanje subcounty says every two proximate sub counties in Rukungiri district are served by a health centre four, but Nyarushanje and Nyakishenyi sub counties were left out because they have Kisizi hospital, a private hospital yet not everyone can afford its charges   Musime noted that he has already written to the ministry of health through Rukungiri district chief administrative office   for   a health center four that will provide health services to the people.

Title: OTT out, Excise duty In.
Content:
Users of mobile phones will effective Today, July 1, have to pay a 12 per cent Excise Duty on the value of data, airtime and other value-added services they use, each time they top up.

The tax replaces the daily 200 Shillings Over the Top -OTT Service tax that was considered unfair es

  Also, an increase in the tax on fuel, by 100 Shillings per litre of petrol to 1,450 Shillings comes into effect today as the    the financial year 2021/2022 begins.

The government is focusing on increasing domestic revenues by at least 16 per cent,  

Other amendments made were on the Income Tax Act, aimed at harmonizing the administration of tax on rental income.

The Act provides for an increase in the rate for the rental income tax for individuals from 20 per cent to 30 per cent

  This will also apply to other locally made alcoholic beverages that have previously not been subjected to excise duty, including those considered health drinks, like Kombucha, Kaziire, Mukama Nayamba and Kituzi.

Title: Ntungamo Covid-19 Positives reject home based care.
Content:
Medics and leaders in Ntungamo district are getting concerned as residents who test positive for COVID-19 at different testing centres in the district resist going back home for home based care on recommendation of medics.

The medics say the residents argue that when they go home they will infect people at their households since most of their homes are congested and can’t have room for self isolation.

They want to remain at health centres they are tested from for specialized treatment and medical attention.

However Ntungamo district has not set up any COVID-19 treatment centre an issue leaders blame on logistics, finances and space at health units.

Ms Aphia Ankunda the in charge Ntungamo health centre IV says at least 52% of the patients who turn up at the health centre   are found positive.

The Ntungamo district COVID-19 task force set up Rubaare health centre IV, Kitwe health centre IV, Rwashamaire health centre IV, Itojo Hospital, Ntungamo health centre III, for rapid tests and Mirama Hills Border post for sample collection for other specialized tests.

However the district health officer Dr Richard Bakamuturaki says they have not established any COVID-19 treatment centre as Itojo hospital is congested

Title: Suspected assassins' held in Kampala, gun and bomb making materials recovered.
Content:
Three suspected assassins are in Police custody  while one has been put out of action as Police in Kampala  moved to  arrest of the assailants who at the start of last month attacked Works and Transport Minister Gen Edward Katumba Wamala, killing his daughter and driver.

Deputy Inspector General of Police Gen Paul Lokech told reporters at the Police Headquarters in Kampala today that all four of the attackers were arrested and that one of them was shot dead in the process.

Police has been tracking the for weeks, until their eventual arrest hours ago in Kikaya, Nansana and Katooke  

   Gen Lokech revealed that during the arrest, the suspects were found with materials and literature used in making bombs  

  One of the attackers, identified   as Hussein Wahab Lubwama also known as Master was gunned down in the arrest process.

  Police is now holding one Kanabe ; who was being ridden on the motorcycle by a Mudinka real names Walusimbi Kamada. 

 Lokech says one of the guns used in the attack has been recovered while the second gun has not been recovered   

 The development comes days after police charged two suspects in connection to the same attack on Gen Katumba.

 The two are Ismael Hussein Sserubula, 38 and Nyanzi Yusuf Siraje, 46

   The DIGP also revealed that the suspects belong to an ADF cell headed by a one Shiek Abudin Hubaida Taheel Bukenya who is still on the run or in hiding in Eastern Democratic Republic of Congo.

Title: Rukungiri church donates to vulnerable families.
Content:
By Derrick Ampereza

Rukungiri community Church has today donated Relief food including 500 kgs of posho and 100 bars of soap worth 1.4 million shillings to residents of Kyabahaga parish Bwambara subcounty Rukungiri district  as a way of supporting  vulnerable people in this covid 19 lockdown . 

Pastor Elisha Kakwerere the head of Rukungiri community church Amaziba  Ministries, says that the food relief items were bought from the money which well-wishers under the church willingly contributed which was meant to help over 100 families with food  and soap  to wash their hands regularly to protect themselves from covid 19.

Chris Kangayano the local council three chairperson Bwambara sub county hailed Pastor Kakwerere for the donation to the people of Kyabahaga  

Some of the beneficiaries Prida Tumuhimbise, and Denis Kamugisha who works as the local council one chairperson kyabahaga parish hailed Amaziba ministries for the donation

Title: Court Martial has no power to try civillians; constitutional court.
Content:
The Constitutional Court has ruled that the Court Martial has no powers to try civilians.

In a majority ruling of three justices against two, the court ruled that although the Court Martial is a competent court under the 1995 Constitution, its powers are only limited to serving officers of the Uganda People’s Defense Forces.

The court’s ruling follows a 2016 petition by the then Nakawa Member of Parliament Michael Kabaziguruka challenging his trial in the General Court Martial.

 Kabaziguruka was accused of being found with firearms a preserve of armed forces.   Kabaziguruka who was arrested and detained for several months denied the charges which he called politically motivated.    
Justices, Kenneth Kakuru, Remmy Kasule and Hellen Obura argued that the UPDF Act was never intended to be an Act of general application.

 Kakuru specifically said that it is a statute of a special and limited application whose power only relates to UPDF alone.  
 He added that there cannot be a fair trial before a Court that is not independent and Impartial.     The court also ruled that all those persons not subject to military law and are currently being tried before any military court, their cases should be transferred to civil courts under the direction of the Director of Public Prosecutions within 14 days from the date of the judgment.
